title: Rainow Walks

images.title: Dave Dunford / Robin Hood, Rainow
images.caption: Robin Hood, Rainow. The B5470 enters the Peak District en route for Whaley Bridge at this point. The Old Chapel (now converted to business units) is in the background to the right.

images.title: Dave Dunford / Thornsett Farm
images.caption: Thornsett Farm. Part of the village of Rainow is visible to the left of the farm, and directly behind it the prominent hill is Big Low (SJ957770). Taken from the Gritstone Way.

images.title: Dean Valley towards Rainow by Peter Turner, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dean Valley towards Rainow

images.title: Lamaload Reservoir by Stephen Craven, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lamaload Reservoir

description: This Cheshire based village sits in a peaceful rural location in the valley of the River Dean which flows just south of the settlement. This circular walk from the village takes you to one of the area highlights at Lamaload Reservoir. The route starts in the village and heads south east towards Thornsett Farm. You continue east through the Dean Valley countryside to the reservoir. Here you can try a lovely circular trail around the water with some nice woodland trails. The route then heads north west past Yearns Low to Ginclough before returning to the village. To continue your walking around Rainow pick up the Gritstone Trail to the west of the village. You can follow this popular waymarked trail south to visit the wonderful viewpoint at Tegg's Nose Country Park. Less than a mile to the north west there's the climb to White Nancy just outside Bollington .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village you can enjoy some post exercise relaxation and refreshment at the Robin Hood. The pub has a large car park and a fine outdoor decking area with splendid views towards White Nancy and other Peak District hills. The quaint old inn also serves fine food with a good tapas selection on the menu. You can find them at Chapel Brow with postcode SK10 5XE for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and country trails make for a fine dog walk. The Robin Hood mentioned above is also dog friendly.
